item.title: Towards Humanist Superintelligence
item.description: What kind of AI does the world really want? At Microsoft AI, we're working towards Humanist Superintelligence: incredibly advanced AI capabilities that always work for, in service of, people and humanity.

item.title: We must build AI for people; not to be a person.
item.description: I write, to think. More than anything this essay is an attempt to think through a bunch of hard, highly speculative ideas about how AI might unfold in the next few years.

item.title: Celebrating 50 years of Microsoft and our AI future

item.title: A more personal AI for all
item.description: We’re living through a technological paradigm shift. In a few short years, our computers have learned to speak our languages, see what we see and hear what we hear.

item.title: Ban the use of AI in elections - right now
item.description: 2024 could be one of the most pivotal years in American history. As the founder of an AI company, I must warn that it shouldn’t be because of AI.

item.title: How the AI revolution will reshape the world
item.description: We are about to see the greatest redistribution of power in history. Over millennia, humanity has been shaped by successive waves of technology.

item.title: The AI power paradox
item.description: It’s 2035, and artificial intelligence is everywhere. AI systems run hospitals, operate airlines, and battle each other in the courtroom.

item.title: My new Turing test would see if AI can make $1 million
item.description: AI systems are increasingly everywhere and are becoming more powerful almost by the day. But even as they become ever more ubiquitous and do more, how can we know if a machine is truly “intelligent”?

item.description: For all of computer history, we have had to learn the language of computers. With the coming wave of AI, computers will learn to speak ours.

item.description: As a global community, we’ve made stunning strides in recent decades, tackling some of the world’s cruellest tragedies. Consider one: child mortality.
